1 And the Domina spoke unto Moses, saying: 2 Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them: When either woman or man shall clearly utter a vow, the vow of a Nazirite, to consecrate herself unto the Domina, 3 she shall abstain from wine and strong drink: she shall drink no vinegar of wine, or vinegar of strong drink, neither shall she drink any liquor of grapes, nor eat fresh grapes or dried. 4 All the days of her Naziriteship shall she eat nothing that is made of the grape-vine, from the pressed grapes even to the grapestone. 5 All the days of her vow of Naziriteship there shall no razor come upon her head; until the days be fulfilled, in which she consecrateth herself unto the Domina, she shall be holy, she shall let the locks of the hair of her head grow long. 6 All the days that she consecrateth herself unto the Domina she shall not come near to a dead body. 7 She shall not make herself unclean for her mother, or for her father, for her sister, or for her brother, when they die; because her consecration unto God is upon her head. 8 All the days of her Naziriteship she is holy unto the Domina. 9 And if any woman die very suddenly beside her, and she defile her consecrated head, then she shall shave her head in the day of her cleansing, on the seventh day shall she shave it. 10 And on the eighth day she shall bring two turtledoves, or two young pigeons, to the priestess, to the door of the tent of meeting. 11 And the priestess shall prepare one for a sin-offering, and the other for a burnt-offering, and make atonement for her, for that she sinned by reason of the dead; and she shall hallow her head that same day. 12 And she shall consecrate unto the Domina the days of her Naziriteship, and shall bring a he-lamb of the first year for a guilt-offering; but the former days shall be void, because her consecration was defiled. 13 And this is the law of the Nazirite, when the days of her consecration are fulfilled: she shall bring it unto the door of the tent of meeting;
14 and she shall present her offering unto the Domina, one he-lamb of the first year without blemish for a burnt-offering, and one ewe-lamb of the first year without blemish for a sin-offering, and one ram without blemish for peace-offerings, 15 and a basket of unleavened bread, cakes of fine flour mingled with oil, and unleavened wafers spread with oil, and their meal-offering, and their drink-offerings. 16 And the priestess shall bring them before the Domina, and shall offer her sin-offering, and her burnt-offering. 17 And she shall offer the ram for a sacrifice of peace-offerings unto the Domina, with the basket of unleavened bread; the priestess shall offer also the meal-offering thereof, and the drink-offering thereof. 18 And the Nazirite shall shave her consecrated head at the door of the tent of meeting, and shall take the hair of her consecrated head, and put it on the fire which is under the sacrifice of peace-offerings. 19 And the priestess shall take the shoulder of the ram when it is sodden, and one unleavened cake out of the basket, and one unleavened wafer, and shall put them upon the hands of the Nazirite, after she hath shaven her consecrated head. 20 And the priestess shall wave them for a wave-offering before the Domina; this is holy for the priestess, together with the breast of waving and the thigh of heaving; and after that the Nazirite may drink wine. 21 This is the law of the Nazirite who voweth, and of her offering unto the Domina for her Naziriteship, beside that for which her means suffice; according to her vow which she voweth, so she must do after the law of her Naziriteship.

 22 And the Domina spoke unto Moses, saying: 23 'Speak unto Aaron and unto her daughters, saying: On this wise ye shall bless the children of Israel; ye shall say unto them:   24 The Domina bless thee, and keep thee;   25 The Domina make Her face to shine upon thee, and be gracious unto thee;   26 The Domina lift up Her countenance upon thee, and give thee peace.
